DataElement.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Route of Administration Assessment Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the method of delivery or route of administration for a substance of abuse.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Route of Administration Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment of the route of administration (the course by which a substance was administered in order to reach the site of action in the body) of an illegal drug or compound (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Maladaptive pattern of drug or alcohol use that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems.

Concepts.definition: Maladaptive pattern of drug or alcohol use that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems.

Property.preferredName: Illicit Substance Route of Administration Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: Something (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction.:The course by which a substance was administered in order to reach the site of action in the body.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Something (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction.

Designation of the part of the body through which or into which, or the way in which, the medicinal product is intended to be introduced. In some cases a medicinal product can be intended for more than one route and/or method of administration.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Substance Abuse Route of Administration Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the method of delivery or route of administration for a substance of abuse.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Administration within or into a vein or veins.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug within or into a vein or veins. Introduction of the drug directly into venous circulation results in 100% bioavailability due to an absence of the absorption phase, provides a precise and continuous mode of drug therapy, especially for drugs with a narrow therapeutic index.
Intradermal injection is a method of drug administration within the substance of the skin, particularly the dermis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Route of drug administration not specified on this list.

Concepts.definition: Route of drug administration not specified on this list.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Administration of a drug by the way of the nose. This often results in systemic action of the agent due to absorption through the nasal mucosa. The richly supplied vascular nature of the nasal mucosa coupled with its high drug permeation makes the nasal route of administration attractive for many drugs, including proteins and peptides.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug by the way of the nose. This often results in systemic action of the agent due to absorption through the nasal mucosa. The richly supplied vascular nature of the nasal mucosa coupled with its high drug permeation makes the nasal route of administration attractive for many drugs, including proteins and peptides.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The introduction of a substance to the mouth or into the gastrointestinal tract by the way of the mouth, usually for systemic action. It is the most common, convenient, and usually the safest and least expensive route of drug administration, but it uses the most complicated pathway to the tissues and bioavailability varies. The disadvantages of method are hepatic first pass metabolism and enzymatic degradation of the drug within the gastrointestinal tract. This prohibits oral administration of certain classes of drugs especially peptides and proteins.

Concepts.definition: The introduction of a substance to the mouth or into the gastrointestinal tract by the way of the mouth, usually for systemic action. It is the most common, convenient, and usually the safest and least expensive route of drug administration, but it uses the most complicated pathway to the tissues and bioavailability varies. The disadvantages of method are hepatic first pass metabolism and enzymatic degradation of the drug within the gastrointestinal tract. This prohibits oral administration of certain classes of drugs especially peptides and proteins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Administration of a substance in the form of a gas, aerosol, or fine powder via the respiratory tract, usually by oral or nasal inhalation, for local or systemic effect.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a substance in the form of a gas, aerosol, or fine powder via the respiratory tract, usually by oral or nasal inhalation, for local or systemic effect.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
